pullRequest.title: Add an API to get the type of an expression
pullRequest.bodyText:
Purpose
This PR adds support for looking up the type of an AST node, given the location of the node.
Check List

 Read the Contributing Guide
 Updated Change Log
 Checked Tooling Support (#)
 Added necessary tests

 Unit Tests
 Spec Conformance Tests
 Integration Tests
 Ballerina By Example Tests


 Increased Test Coverage
 Added necessary documentation

 API documentation
 Module documentation in Module.md files
 Ballerina By Examples

commit.message: Add a visitor to find the node in the given range
Add API for getting types of expressions
Fix position issues in raw template and type init desugaring
Fix pos issues and node finder issues

beforeCommit.message: Fix pos issues and node finder issues

afterCommit.message: Fix pos issues and node finder issues

nodes.bodyText: Shall we mention if the range is not valid, we return an empty optional? Instead of returns null
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -57,6 +58,15 @@
      */
     List<Symbol> moduleLevelSymbols();
 
+    /**
+     * Retrieves the type of the expression in the specified text range. If it's not a valid expression, returns null.

nodes.bodyText: Do we need this null check since we do the null check within the setEnclosingNode method ?
Shall we introduce a base visitor with empty implementation for all the visitor methods? We have a couple of visitors now and for some node we have to duplicate this empty visitor methods.
Calling the super methods throws assertion error

commit.message: Add a base node visitor with empty implementations

nodes.bodyText:
We can optimize this.
Check this one: https://github.com/ballerina-platform/ballerina-lang/blob/master/misc/formatter/modules/formatter-core/src/main/java/org/ballerinalang/formatter/core/FormatterUtils.java#L47:L61
Should this be an abstract class? and probably called AbstractNodeVisitor?
SymbolFinder can also extends from this visitor. There are methods with empty impl in that class. We can get rid of them too.
Throwing an error here goes against the idea of having a base-visitor with empty impl, isn't it?

commit.message: Add tests for casting and checking exprs

nodes.bodyText: Why we are returning NULLs inTypesFactory.getTypeDescriptor(node.type) ? shouldn't it return an optional type-desc ?
